node.title: When Peter O'Keefe was pinned down by police, his mind went 'straight to that fella in America'
node.alt: An older Aboriginal man looking pensive and holding a walking stick
node.description: Peter O'Keefe, 65, says he agreed to go to the police station after a domestic incident. Moments later, he was pinned to the ground.
node.content:
["Peter O'Keefe clutches his walking stick close as he recalls the day he was arrested by Queensland Police.\u00a0\u00a0", "Sitting on his front porch in the remote Aboriginal community of Doomadgee in Queensland's far west,\u00a0flanked by his partner and grandchildren, the memory still hits the 65-year-old\u00a0hard.\u00a0", "\"My mind went straight to that fella [George Floyd]\u00a0in America,\" he said.", "\"So I just let them do what they wanted to do.\"", "WARNING: SOME READERS MAY FIND THE FOLLOWING ACCOUNTS AND VIDEO FOOTAGE DISTRESSING", "It was a blistering August morning in 2020.\u00a0", "Police were called to a domestic disturbance in the community, and Peter, a\u00a0Waanyi Traditional Owner, was wanted for questioning.\u00a0", "The well-known elder in the small, predominantly Indigenous community\u00a0had no criminal record or previous charges.", "", "
Peter O'Keefe with some of his extended family in\u00a0Doomadgee.(ABC News:\u00a0Brendan Mounter)
", "Standing barefoot on the scorching bitumen, in a town that regularly reaches 40 degrees, the elder says he\u00a0agreed\u00a0to head down to the police station.\u00a0", "But Peter told the officer he wanted to first get his thongs from the car. The officer intervened, forcing the car door closed.", "Moments later, the elder was on the ground. The officer had\u00a0pushed his knee into Peter's back as he was restrained, with his face pressed to the bitumen.\u00a0", "Peter had previously undergone shoulder reconstruction and open-heart surgery and was six years off the average life expectancy of an Aboriginal man.\u00a0", "A family member attempted to cradle his head from the road.", "Peter's arrest was captured from multiple angles, in recordings taken by the community, as well as police bodycam vision obtained by the ABC.", "", "
Police bodycam vision shows the incident.
", "\"Well from that day til' today, I can't even walk on my knee, where he done my knee in,\" Mr O'Keefe said.\u00a0", "Peter was charged with obstructing and assaulting police.\u00a0He was not charged with any other offences.", "But in September, those charges were thrown out in the Doomadgee Magistrates Court.\u00a0", "The magistrate deemed the use of force by the male officer\u00a0\"unlawful\" and described the video footage as \"disturbing\".", "
Officer given 'managerial guidance'\u00a0
", "Queensland Police have accepted the determination that the actions in Mr O'Keefe's case were unlawful and conducted their own investigation into the matter.", "\"The officer was given what we call managerial guidance,\"\u00a0Queensland Police Service Assistant Commissioner Mark Wheeler told the ABC.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0", "", "
Mark Wheeler said Queensland Police conducted regular\u00a0cultural training.(ABC News:\u00a0Christopher Gillette)
", "\"The officer was provided with advice on how better next time to use force.\"", "Mr Wheeler said cultural training was regularly assessed.", "\"Some of this is about learning on the job and unfortunately, you can't train police for every single event that's going to arise,\" Mr Wheeler said.\u00a0", "
'Peter's Law'
", "Scott Sier, Mr O'Keefe's lawyer, has taken issue with the fact that the Queensland Police Powers Act does not provide a clear definition of what constitutes reasonable force.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"As it stands the law is simply not prescriptive enough,\" Mr Sier said.\u00a0", "\"[It] has left the door open to saying what reasonable force is.\u00a0\u00a0", "\"And that's a door that absolutely needs to be closed.\"\u00a0", "", "
Mr Sier said Peter's Law would make the use of force clearer.\u00a0(ABC News)
", "Mr Sier has drafted what he has termed \"Peter's Law\", amendments to the act which would ensure factors like a person's cultural background and health be legally considered before engaging in a forceful arrest.", "\"We could look at adding age, culture, race \u2014\u00a0it could be a number of factors that could persuade a police officer to not act in that way or that manner,\" Mr Sier said.", "His recommendation also includes major changes to police training, specifically in relation to Indigenous communities and understanding complex social history.", "
'It's nothing new'
", "Assistant Commissioner Wheeler said legislative change was a matter for the Queensland government and beyond his remit.\u00a0", "But he maintained that the current officer training was culturally sufficient.", "\"There's a suite of training and it's actually specific to the community you go to,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"They do explain the history, the culture, the challenges, the families and some of the unique complexities that arise around those issues,\" Mr Wheeler said.", "Priscilla Atkins, co-chair of Aboriginal legal service network NATSILS, described the footage as \"sickening\".", "", "
Priscilla Atkins said these types of incidents happened regularly.\u00a0(ABC News: Georgia Hitch)
", "\"But it's nothing new, that's the most disappointing thing,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"This happens on a regular basis, right across Australia.\"", "Since the 1991 royal commission, there have been more than 470 Aboriginal deaths in custody.", "The commission found Aboriginal people were apprehended and placed in police cells at over 20 times the rate of non-Aboriginal people.\u00a0", "Aboriginal people currently make up 30 per cent of prisoners.", "\"At the end of the day, no state or territory has been held accountable for that,\" said Ms Atkins.", "\"No one can put their hand up and say: 'Well, this is the plan, we have to address those recommendations.'\"", "For Peter O'Keefe, systemic change can't come soon enough.", "\"If they want to work with the community, they're going to work together,\" he said.", "\"Not them over there and we're over this side, you know, you've got to be treated as one.\"", "Part 2, ABC News\u00a0tomorrow: Brendon and the police in Lake Cargelligo"]
